components.label: HTML
components.content: Loans and grant funding is applicable to students attending post-secondary studies fill-time or part-time.

components.label: HTML
components.content: Grants, scholarships, and other financial supports

components.title: Grants, scholarships, and other financial supports Panel
components.label: Grants, scholarships, and other financial supports
HTML
components.content:
Tuition waiver program
(Youth educational assistance fund for former youth in care)

components.label: HTML
components.content: This program provides grants of up to $5,500 per program year to former B.C. youth in care students between 19 and 24 years of age. Students may receive a maximum of four grants.

components.label: HTML
components.content: Recent graduates in select in-demand occupations can have their B.C. student loans forgiven by agreeing to work at publicly-funded facilities in underserved communities in B.C., or working with children in occupations where there is an identified shortage in B.C.

components.label: HTML
components.content: This program promotes the B.C. public service as a potential employer to new post-secondary graduates, and a progressive employer to current employees.

components.label: HTML
components.content: While students are enrolled in full-time studies, the government can help you pay the interest on your StudentAidBC Loans.
